@ LAZIO88BG - Just an FYI for future reference.

1) It is a 480p BRRip - the A/V quality will be 10/10 ALWAYS.

2) IF there is ever an issue with A/V qaulity 20-40 always makes a note in the comment section and provides a sample for you to decide. This will, generally, only occur with an R5 or CAM version and even then you won't a better version anywhere!!!!!

3) Never, EVER ask about the quality of a 20-40 encode, whether it be 272p, 352p, 480p, 720p or 1080p or 10milllionP. My point is the qauilty will always be good, ALWAYS; Or he will give fair warning and at your own risk.
